block.p: Nassau County Republicans have been forced to reinvent themselves. They have expunged nearly all mention of their county party affiliation from campaign material, aware that Nassau's near fiscal collapse helped propel Democrats to power for the first time in decades last year. Republicans are struggling to maintain control of the State Senate, and see the prospect of losing even a few races in Nassau as a grave threat.

Nassau County Republicans have been forced to reinvent themselves. They have expunged nearly all mention of their county party affiliation from campaign material, aware that Nassau's near fiscal collapse helped propel Democrats to power for the first time in decades last year. Republicans are struggling to maintain control of the State Senate, and see the prospect of losing even a few races in Nassau as a grave threat.
